title.narrative: Social Protection, Innovation and Policy Engagement

description.narrative: Funding under this initiative supports the Philippine Government address social protection reform areas on improvement of service delivery and development of implementation capacities of the Department of Social Welfare and Development. It helps DSWD access local (Philippine) technical assistance (TA) , build its capacity to manage TAs, and provide a mechanism to harmonise donor assistance. It also supports DSWD increase access and utilisation of social services by key vulnerable groups especially indigenous people, homeless street families and the disabled. Primarily, funds are used for TAs on capacity building, researches, analytical and advisory activities in support to formulation of evidence-based decisions and policies. The program supports two major activities: DSWD Technical Assistance Facility for Social Protection Reforms and UNICEF Enhancing Implementation of Modified CCT Program. The total value of this investment is $11 million over 5 years, from 2015-16.
